doc.ContractDescription: IGF::CL,CT::IGF PROCUREMENT OF PROFESSIONAL ACQUISITION SUPPORT SERVICES

DEVELOPMENT OF THE HITRAN COMPILATION TO SUPPORT NASA REMOTE SENSING MISSIONS THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ADVANCE THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE HITRAN (HIGH-RESOLUTION TRANSMISSION) MOLECULAR SPECTROSCOPIC DATABASE COMPILATION AND ASSOCIATED SOFTWARE TO SUPPORT THE NASA OBSERVATION MISSIONS THAT SEEK TO CHARACTERIZE THE ATMOSPHERE USING REMOTE-SENSING EXPERIMENTS, PRIMARILY FROM SPACE. THESE PROGRAMS INCLUDE THE SUITE OF FORMER, CURRENT AND FUTURE EOS EXPERIMENTS, AIRS, HIRDLS, MLS, MOPITT, TES, SAGE III, OMI, AQUA, TERRA, AND FUTURE MISSIONS INCLUDING CLARREO, GEO-CAPE, ASCENDS, OCO-2, AND TEMPO. THIS PROJECT ALSO BENEFITS FROM A CLOSE RELATIONSHIP WITH FOREIGN MISSIONS, INCLUDING ACE, GOSAT, IASI, TOMS, SBUV, GOME, SCIAMACHY AND GOMOS FLYING ON ENVISAT, AS WELL AS FUTURE ASIAN MISSIONS THAT ARE SIMILAR TO TEMPO. THE PRIORITY OF THE PROGRAM IS FOR IMPROVING THE SPECTROSCOPIC PARAMETERS OF MOLECULAR LINE ABSORPTION TRANSITIONS THAT AFFECT THE MODELING AND SIMULATION OF ATMOSPHERIC RADIANCE AND TRANSMISSION RETRIEVALS. SATELLITE REMOTE-SENSING RETRIEVALS, WHICH NOW HAVE EXCEPTIONAL SIGNAL-TO-NOISE, WIDE SPECTRAL COVERAGE, AND RELIABLE RETRIEVAL ALGORITHMS, ARE REQUIRING SIGNIFICANT IMPROVEMENTS IN HITRAN IN ORDER NOT TO BE LIMITED BY THE ATMOSPHERIC ABSORPTION DATABASE COMPONENT OF THE INPUT. AMONG THE NEEDS ARE IMPROVED ACCURACY AND A GLOBAL CONSISTENCY OF LINE INTENSITIES, IMPROVED LINE-SHAPE PARAMETERS AND THE WAYS THEY ARE REPRESENTED, ADDITION OF MISSING MOLECULAR BANDS AND TRACE GAS SPECIES, AND REPRESENTATION OF PHENOMENA THAT ARE IMPACTING THE RETRIEVALS INCLUDING COLLISION-INDUCED ABSORPTION BANDS, ADVANCED LINE-SHAPE FORMALISMS AND LINE COUPLING. THE NEED FOR ADDITIONAL PARAMETERS AND FLEXIBILITY OF THEIR REPRESENTATION REQUIRES RESTRUCTURING THE DATABASE INTO A RELATIONAL DATABASE FORMAT AND SUBSTANTIAL EFFORT WILL BE DIRECTED TOWARDS THAT GOAL. ONE OF THE OUTPUTS OF NEW SYSTEMS WILL BE THE FAMILIAR HITRAN FORMAT- ASCII FILES FOR THOSE USERS THAT WILL NOT REQUIRE NEW FEATURES. DATA VALIDATION IS ALSO A PART OF THE PROPOSED RESEARCH. THE HITRAN COMPILATION FACILITATES A SYNERGISM AMONG THE MANY DIVERSE EXPERIMENTS IN NASA PROGRAMS, LINKING RESULTS WHICH HAVE COMMON GOALS. USER SUPPORT AND IMPROVED INTERFACE FOR NASA PROJECTS IS THUS AN INTEGRAL ASPECT OF THE HITRAN PROJECT.

doc.ContractDescription: OUR INTERDISCIPLINARY TEAM WILL STUDY THE IMPACT OF CHANGES IN ANTARCTIC SEA ICE ON PRIMARY PRODUCERS AND SEABIRD POPULATIONS. WE ARE PARTICULARLY INTERESTED IN EXAMINING THE EFFECT OF GROWING SEA ICE BECAUSE SEA ICE EXTENT (SIE) HAS INCREASED DURING THE LAST DECADE IN SOME ANTARCTIC REGIONS. THIS IS STIMULATED BY OBSERVED DRAMATIC CONSEQUENCES FOR SEABIRDS IN THE FIELD IN THE LAST TWO YEARS BY THE LEADING PI S TEAM IN EASTERN ANTARCTIC (TERRE AD LIE IN PARTICULAR), WHERE SEABIRD ARRIVAL TO THE COLONY AND BREEDING WAS EXTREMELY DELAYED AND BREEDING SUCCESS REDUCED DUE TO EXTREME SIE. WE WILL FOCUS ON SEABIRDS BECAUSE THEY ARE GOOD BIO-INDICATOR SPECIES OF THE ECOLOGICAL CONSEQUENCES OF SEA ICE CHANGES. SEA ICE AND ITS SEASONALITY MAY AFFECT LIFE HISTORY AND TIMING OF LIFE CYCLE EVENTS OF SEABIRDS AND THEIR PREY. THE RATES OF ICE-INDUCED SHIFTS IN PHENOLOGY OFTEN DIFFER BETWEEN PREDATORS AND THEIR PREY, LEADING TO A PHENOLOGICAL MISMATCH BETWEEN THE PEAK AND DURATION OF PHYTOPLANKTON BLOOM AND THE ENERGY-INTENSIVE SEABIRDS BREEDING SEASON. FOR THE FIRST TIME, IN ANTARCTICA, WE WILL QUANTIFY SUCH MISMATCH AND STUDY ITS INFLUENCE ON BREEDING PERFORMANCE AND POPULATIONS OF TOP-PREDATORS BY INTEGRATING MISMATCH IN OUR DEMOGRAPHIC ANALYSIS AND MODEL. FINALLY, GENERAL CIRCULATION MODELS (GCMS) SUGGEST THAT SIE AND SIA ARE PROJECTED TO DECLINE DRAMATICALLY BY THE END OF THIS CENTURY IN ANTARCTICA. CURRENT PREDICTIVE MODELS LINKING CLIMATE TO POPULATIONS LARGELY IGNORE PHENOLOGICAL CHANGES, WHICH MAY RADICALLY AFFECT THEIR PREDICTIONS BECAUSE INDIVIDUALS MAY ADAPT TO CLIMATE CHANGE BY ADJUSTING THEIR PHENOLOGY. WHILE IT IS CONVENIENT TO SPEAK OF SEABIRDS AS A GROUP, THEIR RESPONSES TO PAST AND FUTURE SEA ICE CONDITIONS ARE LIKELY TO BE DIVERSE BECAUSE THEIR BREEDING BIOLOGY, SEASONAL BEHAVIORS, FORAGING AND MIGRATION PATTERNS, AND HABITAT REQUIREMENTS DIFFER. THE NINE SEABIRDS THAT WE WILL ANALYZE INCLUDE SEVERAL DIFFERENT PHENOLOGICAL SHIFTS. WE WILL COMPARE THESE SPECIES IN TERMS OF THEIR LIFE HISTORY AND ECOLOGY TO EXPLORE EXPLANATIONS FOR THESE DIFFERENCES. WE WILL ALSO EXAMINE IF SPECIES WITH A LARGER FLEXIBILITY IN THEIR PHENOLOGY WILL COPE BETTER WITH FUTURE SEA ICE CHANGE. OUR FIRST GOAL IS TO UNDERSTAND THE UNDERLYING MECHANISMS LINKING SEA ICE, PHYTOPLANKTON BLOOMS AND SEABIRDS RESPONSES BY FOCUSING ON THE BEST AVAILABLE OBSERVATION AND MODEL DATA ON PHENOLOGY, REPRODUCTIVE PERFORMANCE AND POPULATION ABUNDANCE OF A SEABIRD COMMUNITY IN EAST ANTARCTICA. SEABIRD PHENOLOGICAL AND POPULATION CHANGES IN OTHER ANTARCTIC REGIONS WILL BE PROJECTED BY PERFORMING A PAN-ANTARCTIC ANALYSIS OF KEY METRICS OF SEA ICE AND ITS SEASONALITY, RELEVANT FOR ANTARCTIC ORGANISMS, AND VARIABLES OF PHYTOPLANKTON BLOOMS AND DURATION. TO DO SO, WE WILL ANALYZE SATELLITE NASA DATA AND REVEAL MECHANISMS USING BIOLOGICAL-PHYSICAL COUPLED MODELING. WE WILL PROJECT SEABIRD RESPONSES USING A DEMOGRAPHIC MODEL INCLUDING PHENOLOGICAL CHANGES. WE WILL PROJECT SEABIRD POPULATION VIABILITY UNDER VARIOUS FUTURE CLIMATE CHANGE SCENARIOS USING A VARIETY OF MODELING APPROACHES TO COMBINE MEASUREMENTS OF REGIONAL SEA ICE CONDITIONS, PRIMARY PRODUCTIVITY AND SEABIRD RESPONSES WITH PREDICTED FUTURE SCENARIOS OF SEA ICE DYNAMICS FROM AN ENSEMBLE OF GCMS.

doc.ContractDescription: WE PROPOSE A RESEARCH PROGRAM INVOLVING TWO CONVENTIONAL BALLOON FLIGHTS FROM FT. SUMNER, NM TO STUDY DEBRIS DISKS OF FIVE STARS. THESE EXPERIMENTS INCREMENTALLY BUILD ON PREVIOUS FLIGHT-PROVEN SUBSYSTEMS WITH A GOAL OF CONDUCTING FUNDAMENTAL SCIENCE WHILE MATURING KEY EXOPLANET TECHNOLOGIES. FLIGHT ONE WILL USE AN 0.6 M OFF-AXIS TELESCOPE SYSTEM IN CONJUNCTION WITH A VISIBLE NULLING CORONAGRAPH TO DIRECTLY IMAGE ALPHA LYR, DELTA DRA AND EPSILON ERI. THE FLIGHT-PROVEN WASP GONDOLA ALONG WITH A FINE POINTING SYSTEM FLIGHT-PROVEN ABOARD OUR SOUNDING ROCKET PROGRAM WILL COMPLETE THE EXPERIMENT COMPLEMENT. IN FLIGHT TWO, A FIELD-PROVEN VECTOR VORTEX CORNAGRAPH WILL REPLACE THE NULLING CORONAGRAPH AND A FIELD-PROVEN INTEGRAL FIELD DETECTOR, THE MKID, WILL REPLACE THE SCIENCE CAMERA OF THE FIRST FLIGHT. THE PLANNED TARGETS FOR THE SECOND FLIGHT ARE ALPHA AQL, TAU CET AND EPSILON ERI. WITH CONSERVATIVE PERFORMANCE ESTIMATES, WE EXPECT TO OBTAIN AN IMAGE OF EPSILON ERI IN THE SECOND FLIGHT AS WELL AS SOME SPECTRAL CHARACTERISTICS. SEVERAL OTHER TARGETS ARE AVAILABLE AND WILL BE SELECTED IF/AS TIME PERMITS. OUR SIMULATIONS INDICATE THE TANTALIZING POSSIBILITY OF OBTAINING A DIRECT IMAGE OF THE SUGGESTED EPSILON ERI B. IF SUCCESSFUL, IT WILL PRODUCE ONE OR MORE IMAGES OF JUPITER-LIKE PLANETS AROUND SUN-LIKE STARS. WITH A DELIBERATE APPROACH OF STEPWISE MATURING KEY ENABLING TECHNOLOGIES WHILE DEMONSTRATING IMPORTANT SCIENCE RESULTS, PLANETARY IMAGING CONCEPT TESTBED USING A RECOVERABLE EXPERIMENT - CORONAGRAPH (PICTURE C ), WILL FIRMLY PUT US ON THE PATH TOWARDS REALIZING THE GOAL OF CHARACTERIZING PLANETS IN THE HABITABLE ZONE. IN THE SHORT-TERM IT WILL FLIGHT DEMONSTRATE HIGH PRIORITY TECHNOLOGIES ENDORSED BY THE AFTA AND STDT STUDIES.

EP-W-11-003 - NATURAL RESOURCES PROTECTION MOD 0083: THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO: (1) OBLIGATE INCREMENTAL FUNDING TO THE BRIDGE CONTRACT PERIOD/LINE ITEM 0043; (2) DEOBLIGATE FUNDING FROM OPTION PERIOD IV/LINE ITEM 0041 AND THE BRIDGE CONTRACT PERIOD/LINE ITEM 0043 FOR WORK THAT HAS BEEN STOPPED. MOD 0082: THIS BILATERAL MODIFICATION IS BEING ISSUED TO INCORPORATE INTO CONTRACT EP-W-11-003 THE TERMS OF THE CONFIDENTIAL SETTLEMENT AGREEMENT CONSISTING OF EIGHT (8) TYPED PAGES, WHICH WAS ENTERED INTO BY ABT ASSOCIATES INC, BY AND THROUGH ITS VICE PRESIDENT AND GENERAL COUNSEL, BRIAN ROEMER, AND THE UNITED STATES ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY, BY AND THROUGH ITS CONTRACTING OFFICERS SHEILA FAGAN, NATALIA FISHER-JACKSON, STEFAN MARTIYAN, GENINE MCELROY, CHRISTINE EDWARDS, AND NOELLE MILLS, EFFECTIVE (ENTER THE DATE OF THE LAST SIGNATURE ON THE SETTLEMENT AGREEMENT), AS SET FORTH ON PAGES 3 THROUGH 10 OF THIS MODIFICATION. PRIOR YEAR FUNDS BEING OBLIGATED TO FUND THE CONFIDENTIAL SETTLEMENT AGREEMENT WILL BE PAID FROM THE FOLLOWING ACCOUNTING LINE FROM OPTION PERIOD IV OF THE CONTRACT: 14-15-B-40DF-201B53X28-2505-1440SRE065-001 MOD 0081: THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO EXECUTE A SIX (6) MONTH BRIDGE CONTRACT EXTENSION AND TO INCREASE THE OPTION PERIOD IV ESTIMATED COST CEILING BY $1,850,043.00 AND THE FIXED FEE CEILING BY $148,003.00. ADDITIONALLY, INCREMENTAL FUNDING IS OBLIGATED TO THE CONTRACT TOTALING $763,180.89 AND ADD THE FEDCONNECT CLAUSE.
